snippet: Some minority students who get into a top school with the help of affirmative action might be better served by attending a less elite institution.
abstract: Op-Ed article by lawyer and author Dan Slater questions whether affirmative action is detrimental to some minority students who get into top schools, citing the theory of 'mismatch,' which suggests that the policy can harm students by placing them at schools in which they fall below the median level of ability; contends if Supreme Court allows affirmative action to continue, it is worth taking closer, numbers-based look at consequences policy has for everyone.
lead_paragraph: Some minority students who get into a top school with the help of affirmative action might be better served by attending a less elite institution.

headline.main: Does Affirmative Action Do What It Should?
headline.print_headline: Does Affirmative Action Do What It Should?
